title: What is your strange pocket pick that you think is broken, but you can't play cause it's "troll"
body: Personally, mine is {{champion:236}}  mid. It's very lane dominant in the correct matchup, going for an AD caster build with a {{item:3134}} and  {{item:3158}}. Dashing everywhere all the time is great against skillshot reliant champs like {{champion:126}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} . the reason I say this is because I've seen it in action at least 3 times against long range skillshot mages. Every time what happens is that the enemy mid simply does not try to kill Lucian if it looks like the Lucian is any good. They can sit at their tower and AFK waveclear until 6. You can't force them to come out since you have no CC and a range of 500.

Later on, the enemy base damage alone, if they land even 2 spells, is enough to send you recalling or risking dying to 2nd rotation, while your autos don't actually threaten them.

Then late game, your team now has 2 AD carries with 500-600 range, and thus 2 team members with either no or very weak CC and burst, AND only AD damage. Meanwhile, the enemy team has 1 AD carry and 1 long range mid with 700-1000 range, and at least the mid will have some sort of CC. The team comp with Lucian also forces an AP top or jungler, realistically which means {{champion:8}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:76}} ... all of which aren't the greatest CCers.

There's alot more effective non-meta picks than Lucian mid. Even Sona mid is better; I've seen it all in action.

You forgot {{champion:13}} for your AP top laners.  You could also run some of those pocket pick top laners (or not-so-pocket picks), such as {{champion:60}} (has some cc and range harass, can be tanky or damage based), {{champion:31}} (significant range, strong cc, plenty of damage or tankiness), {{champion:79}} (same as Cho), {{champion:85}} (AoE stun field and strong damage, not so good if you want tankiness though), {{champion:57}} (that's some cc and tankiness right there), {{champion:127}} (not usually tanky but has damage and cc), {{champion:44}} (does mostly magic damage but also shreds armor and buffs AD, has some cc).  I am sure there are others I didn't list, but it is pretty substantial as is.

For your ADC woes you could run {{champion:51}}, {{champion:18}} or {{champion:222}} to deal with the range problems.  If you needed more cc than range you could trade out for {{champion:22}}, {{champion:110}} or {{champion:222}} again.  Actually, all of those had high range as well.

In your jungle you are more restricted if you want to have high AP damage.  I am only thinking of {{champion:31}}, {{champion:79}}, {{champion:9}} and {{champion:131}}.  However, if you aren't looking for lots of damage there are a plethora of high cc and tanky junglers who deal magic damage (the list significantly overlaps with the top laner list, but does have some not on it).

In the end, Lucian mid is a pocket pick.  You can have a team he works in, but not every team will do.

You could run Cho or Kennen top which is fine. However, Kennen mains are rare and Cho is a risky bet for top/jungle due to his immobility. Good lane bully and CC bot though.

I would seriously rather not force people to take a pick, and to actually help the team win the game. Lucian mid is an extremely selfish pick, just like Zed and Talon are, except Lucian doesn't even snowball as hard as they do.

I thought that the idea was you pick Lucian after you see the other stuff.

I agree that forcing your team to pick around your pick is pretty bad, but picking something unusual because they can fit the spot is fine.
